item.title: J&K: Former DSP among 6 killed after fire breaks out at house in Kathua - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Tragic Fire in Kathua Claims Six Lives Including Former DSP

Date: December 18, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

A significant fire incident occurred in Jammu and Kashmir’s Kathua district, leading to the tragic deaths of six individuals, including a former deputy superintendent of police and his young grandson. The fire broke out in the early hours, with locals discovering it around 2:30 AM.

  • The deceased include Avtar Krishen Raina, 81, former DSP, and his 3-year-old grandson.
  • Four others were injured and are receiving treatment at the Government Medical College in Kathua.
  • Preliminary investigations indicate that victims died from smoke inhalation.
  • Union Minister Jitendra Singh expressed his condolences on social media.
  • The police have initiated an investigation into the incident.
“Deeply shocked to learn about the accidental death of 6 members of a family resulting from fire incident in the Shiv Nagar area of Kathua city.” - Jitendra Singh

This unfortunate incident has highlighted serious concerns regarding fire safety and the urgent need for better awareness in residential areas.

This meeting underscores the ongoing diplomatic efforts to normalize ties after years of tensions, particularly following the Galwan Valley clash in 2020.

item.title: Delhi AQI: Air quality at ‘severe-plus’ category in some areas amid GRAP curbs - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi AQI: Air quality at ‘severe-plus’ category in some areas amid GRAP curbs

Date: December 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Delhi faced dangerously high levels of air pollution with the overall Air Quality Index (AQI) reaching over 440, classifying the air quality as ‘severe’. The city implemented Stage 4 restrictions under the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) to combat the pollution crisis.

  • Overall AQI recorded at 442 at 7 am on December 18, 2024.
  • Some monitoring stations reported AQI levels in the ‘severe-plus’ category beyond 450.
  • AQI levels at worst stations: Nehru Nagar (480), Alipur (471), Anand Vihar (481).
  • Stage 4 restrictions include a ban on construction activities and non-essential vehicle entry into Delhi.
  • Experts attribute rising pollution to low wind speeds and various local factors.
“Breathing Delhi's polluted air is equivalent to smoking approximately 10 cigarettes a day.”

The ongoing air quality crisis necessitates urgent action and compliance with GRAP restrictions to protect public health.

item.title: Donald Trump's message to India over high tariffs: 'They tax us, we tax them' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Trump's Stance on High Tariffs: A Call for Reciprocity with India

Date: Dec 18, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Donald Trump, in a recent statement, made it clear that fairness in trade is crucial, emphasizing that the United States will impose reciprocal tariffs on countries like India that impose high tariffs on American goods.

  • Trump plans to implement tariffs equivalent to those charged by other nations on US exports.
  • He expressed that if India charges a 100% tariff on US products, the US will respond similarly.
  • His comments were aimed at highlighting inequities in trade practices between the US and countries like India and Brazil.
“Reciprocal. If they tax us, we tax them the same amount,” Trump stated.

In conclusion, Trump's administration is likely to continue focusing on ensuring equitable trade practices and considering reciprocity in tariff policies, which may shape future US-India trade relations.

item.title: Why bring religion into the armed forces, ex-servicemen organisation poses questions to CDS and chiefs - The Hindu
item.description:
Veterans Question Religious Symbols in Armed Forces After Painting Removal

Published on: December 18, 2024 - Source: The Hindu

Veterans have expressed concerns over the introduction of religious themes in military symbols following the controversial removal of a historic painting commemorating the 1971 India-Pakistan war from the Army chief's lounge.

  • Brigadier Inder Mohan Singh from the IESL questioned the relevance of introducing religion in the armed forces.
  • The painting was replaced with a new artwork that included cultural symbols like Garuda and Krishna's chariot.
  • Mohan emphasized that the removal was seen as an attack on historical military heritage.
  • The new painting, 'Karam Kshetra - Field of Deeds', features modern military equipment along with historically significant imagery.
  • Mohan called to gift the historical painting to the IESL for preservation.
“To finish photos which reflect history is an unpardonable act.” – Brigadier Inder Mohan Singh

The discussion continues as veterans seek clarity on how these changes reflect the values and traditions of the armed forces.

item.title: Delhi remains India’s most polluted city for second day in a row; GRAP Stage IV restrictions kick in - The Hindu
item.description:
Delhi remains India’s most polluted city for second day in a row; GRAP Stage IV restrictions kick in

Published: December 18, 2024 - Source: The Hindu

Delhi's air quality has deteriorated significantly, making it the most polluted city in India for two consecutive days. The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) has issued warnings about the health impacts of this severe pollution.

  • Delhi's air quality index (AQI) reached severe levels, recording a measure of 401 at 10 p.m. on December 6, 2024.
  • The AQI is on a scale of 0-500, where 401-450 is 'severe'.
  • Pollution levels are attributed to stubble burning, vehicular emissions, and stagnant weather conditions.
  • Stage IV of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) has been implemented, limiting construction activities and older vehicles.
  • Pollution is expected to stay high with PM2.5 levels at 251.5 micrograms per cubic meter, exceeding WHO's safe limit.
“Severe-level air pollution affects healthy people and seriously impacts those with existing diseases.” - CPCB

The ongoing pollution crisis in Delhi is prompting renewed calls for action and greater awareness of air quality issues.

item.title: 'One Nation, One Election' bill introduced in Lok Sabha, Opposition demands withdrawal - The New Indian Express
item.description:
One Nation, One Election Bill Introduced Amidst Opposition Demands for Withdrawal

Date: 17 Dec 2024 | Source: The New Indian Express

Union Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal introduced the 'One Nation, One Election' bill, seeking to hold simultaneous Lok Sabha and state assembly elections, facing strong opposition urging its withdrawal.

  • Introduction of the Constitution (One Hundred and Twenty-Ninth Amendment) Bill, 2024, and the Union Territories Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2024.
  • First-time use of electronic voting in the Lok Sabha.
  • 269 members in favor and 198 against during the introduction of the bills.
  • Opposition parties claim the bills are anti-democratic and violate the Constitution.
  • Support from NDA allies, but uncertainty from fence-sitters.
“Beyond the seventh schedule of the Constitution is the basic structured doctrine and that basic structure doctrine spells out that there are certain features of the Indian Constitution which are beyond the amending power of this House also.” - Congress MP Manish Tewari

The introduction of the ONOE bills marks a significant step towards electoral reform, yet faces a complex path filled with political contention and opposition scrutiny.

Chennai Weather: Heavy Rain Likely In Chennai For 2 Days, Orange Alert In 4 TN Districts

Date: December 17, 2024 Source: News18

The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a weather warning for Chennai due to a low-pressure area in the Bay of Bengal. The effects are expected to last for several days.

  • A low-pressure area has formed over the South Bay of Bengal.
  • An orange alert has been issued for very heavy rainfall in several districts.
  • Heavy rain is expected in Chennai and surrounding areas on December 17 and 18.
  • The rain is likely to intensify on December 19 and continue until December 20.
  • Chennai, Chengalpattu, Tiruvallur, and Puducherry are among the districts affected.
"The Meteorological Department warns of very heavy rainfall on Tuesday and expects rainfall to begin around 1 pm, intensifying throughout the day."

This weather condition is significant for the affected areas, with warnings issued to prepare for potential heavy rainfall impacts.

item.title: ‘BJP Ended One Nation, Two Constitutions’: JP Nadda On J&K During Rajya Sabha Debate - News18
item.description:
BJP Ends One Nation, Two Constitutions Policy in J&K: JP Nadda

Published on: December 17, 2024, Source: News18

During a debate in the Rajya Sabha, Union Minister JP Nadda highlighted that the BJP-led government has ended the policy of one nation, two constitutions in Jammu and Kashmir. He criticized the Congress for its historical decisions and emphasized the importance of constitutional amendments.

  • Nadda stated that 106 laws passed by Parliament were not applicable to J&K under the previous policy.
  • He invoked Sardar Patel and criticized the Congress for its historical handling of Jammu and Kashmir.
  • Nadda invited Congress to mark the 50th anniversary of the Emergency imposed in India.
  • He argued against the practice of triple talaq in the context of Islamic nations.
  • The debate continues in the Rajya Sabha following significant discussions in the Lok Sabha on constitutional significance.
“The then Home Minister Sardar Patel was given the work of uniting the country and I was very happy that after a long time, I heard the name of Sardar Patel from the Congress side too.” - JP Nadda

This debate reflects ongoing political tensions in India regarding the interpretation and application of constitutional provisions in varying contexts.

item.title: GRAP-4: Delhi-NCR Schools To Go Hybrid For All Classes Except Grades 10, 12 - News18
item.description:
GRAP-4: Delhi-NCR Schools To Go Hybrid For All Classes Except Grades 10, 12

Date: December 17, 2024 | Source: News18

Schools in Delhi-NCR will shift to hybrid classes, combining online and physical attendance for most grades, due to severe air quality issues.

  • Classes VI to IX and XI will now be hybrid as part of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) Stage 4.
  • Decision triggered by alarming Air Quality Index levels surpassing 400.
  • Schools in districts like Gurugram, Faridabad, and Ghaziabad are included in this mandate.
  • Despite guidelines, some Noida schools are reportedly not following the hybrid directive and are still conducting in-person classes.
“Noida schools are very much offline; they have not declared hybrid classes.” - Ayesha Singh, Parent

The hybrid model aims to ensure safety and continuity of education amid worsening air quality in the region.
